subject: Sales
title: The Stall and How to Break It
description: A fast breakdown of The Stall and How to Break It for builders.

hook.text: The buyer says 'Let me think about it' and vanishes forever. The polite stall wins every time.

buildup.text: Stalling is the gentlest form of 'no.' Buyers use it to avoid confrontation, not to actually think.

discovery.text: The antidote is clarity. Ask directly: 'What specifically would you need to think through?'

twist.text: Sometimes the stall is real. Respect it â€” but always set a concrete next step before you leave.

climax.text: Never leave without a scheduled follow-up. Vague timelines are exactly where deals go to die.

punchline.text: A vague 'let me think' means the deal is dying.

quiz.question: How should you respond to 'Let me think about it'?
options: Ask what specifically they need to think through
